Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for the 2016 International Conference on Networking, Architecture, and Storage (NAS'16)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration: This request is for support to broaden and diversify the student participation in the 11th IEEE International Conference on Networking, Architecture, and Storage (NAS), a premier international forum for the presentation of research results in networking, high-performance computer architecture, and parallel and distributed data storage technologies. It seeks to increase student participation in symposium and the field. The proposed funding would support the travel of eligible US students to the symposium. Travel grants encourage the research interests and the involvement of students in the field who are not well funded and those who are just beginning their participation in the field or are interested in entering it. A special effort is made to reach out to women and under-represented minorities. Preference is given to students who will present their research at NAS.

Institution.Name: University of California-Riverside
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA AT RIVERSIDE

POR.DRECONTENT:
The major goal of this project is to support students from US universities to attend the 11th IEEE International Conference on Networking, Architecture, and Storage (NAS 2016) held from August 8 − 10, 2016 at Hyatt Regency Long Beach in Long Beach, USA. NAS 2016 provided a high-quality international forum to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to discuss cutting-edge research on networking, high-performance computer architecture, and parallel and distributed data storage technologies. With the support from this project, a call for travel support application has been posted at the conference website of NAS 2016 (http://www.nas-conference.org/NAS-2016/student_grant.html). More than 30 travel support applications were recieved. The project personel reviewed the qualifications of applicants and finally awarded 18 student travel grants to support 18 students to attend the NAS 2016. Due to two students withdraw after we awarded the travel awards, there is a reamining balance of $1316.17 for this project. The remianing balance has been refunded to National Science Foundation.  With 18 students from US universities awarded the travel grants, NAS 2016 successfully increased the students' participation of this conference. Through attending the NAS 2016 conference, these students increased their knowledge on the state-of-the-art technologies on networking, architecture, and storage.


 


Last Modified: 11/29/2017
Modified by: Zizhong Chen
POR.POR_COPY_TXT: The major goal of this project is to support students from US universities to attend the 11th IEEE International Conference on Networking, Architecture, and Storage (NAS 2016) held from August 8 − 10, 2016 at Hyatt Regency Long Beach in Long Beach, USA. NAS 2016 provided a high-quality international forum to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to discuss cutting-edge research on networking, high-performance computer architecture, and parallel and distributed data storage technologies. With the support from this project, a call for travel support application has been posted at the conference website of NAS 2016 (http://www.nas-conference.org/NAS-2016/student_grant.html). More than 30 travel support applications were recieved. The project personel reviewed the qualifications of applicants and finally awarded 18 student travel grants to support 18 students to attend the NAS 2016. Due to two students withdraw after we awarded the travel awards, there is a reamining balance of $1316.17 for this project. The remianing balance has been refunded to National Science Foundation. With 18 students from US universities awarded the travel grants, NAS 2016 successfully increased the students' participation of this conference. Through attending the NAS 2016 conference, these students increased their knowledge on the state-of-the-art technologies on networking, architecture, and storage.
